item.title: Report E-2023120005
item.description:
Report E-2023120005

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: EAST SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, a 330-gallon tote containing approximately 295-gallons of Ethyl Thioglycolate (UN2810) was crushed and punctured as a result of improper loading. This resulted in 4-gallons of product spilling onto the trailer floor and the asphalt below. A Contractor cleaned-up the release and performed a tote transfer. The damaged tote was cut-up and containerized into two UN-rated shipping containers for disposal. No storm drains, water ways, or soil were impacted by the release.

item.description:
Report E-2023110617

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: GRAND PRAIRIE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 21, 2023, at 1950 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Grand Prairie, Texas regarding the release of approximately (1) gallon of NOX-RUSTÂ® 7703-W (UN1268 PETROLEUM DISTILLATES, N.O.S., (Naphtha Solvent), Combustible liquid, PG III) from (1) 55-gallon DM. It was reported the release was contained to an area of concrete only. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors were informed that facility personnel cleaned the spill and overpacked the damaged container. All waste was staged onsite in preparation for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110616
item.description:
Report E-2023110616

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: CHESTERFIELD
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 22, 2023, at 1135 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Chesterfield, Michigan regarding the release of approximately (2) gallons of UN1263 PAINT 3, III from (1) IBC tote. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Contractors were able to clean the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55- Gallon DM which was then staged on-site by the contractor in preparation for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110615
item.description:
Report E-2023110615

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: CLACKAMAS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPO experienced a release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 ounce of material released to the packaging/container only. The cap of one 1-gallon poly jug was crushed causing a release. The damaged jug was removed from the box and containerized along with PPE into a 15-gallon poly jug. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110614
item.description:
Report E-2023110614

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-20
  • City: MONROE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 20, 2023, one (1) 55-gallond drum containing UN3264 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the sulfuric acid solution-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and excess debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110613
item.description:
Report E-2023110613

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-20
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 20, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2810 fell off the lift gate and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental (GME) to remediate the impacted site. GME personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the UN2810-impacted trailer and roadway. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 95-gallon overpack and taken to the R+L terminal for disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was dropped and damaged during sortation causing the liquid to leak wetting the contents and carton. Pkg was placed leaking in an unauthorized unlined plastic bin damaging/contaminating the bin. The pkg in the bin was sent to QA where it was later taken to the HMPA for inspection and proper handling. DescribePack: Safety ring and friction lid failed when pkg was dropped. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in bin.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet and soiled near the taggers on bank 3 of the RORS unload. Package had a Corrosive 8 labeling (UN1824) and was immediately taken off the warehouse floor and isolated from the rest of the staff. Package was a fully regulated HazMat. Package was unloaded from facility 608. DescribePack: The one plastic bottle inside had its cap bent severely to the side. This compromised the item and the seal underneath, which allowed for liquid to begin leaking from the bottle. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat Cage for isolation and processing.

Then brought it to cage 1 to work. DescribePack: I found that the 2.5 gallon of cleaner had a loose cap which caused the bottle to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I placed damaged package into a red hazmat bin with liner to stop spillage. I checked the surrounding area to make sure damage package didn't leak on any other packages or was on floor.

item.description:
Report X-2023110934

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found on van line on 11/10 appearing mostly undamaged but with small paint leak or smear on top closure. Package was isolated from sort by line manager for inspection by QA. As box is an undeclared hazmat with no markings on box, it was placed in black non-hazmat bin with plain plastic liner and brought to QA for inspection. QA was unable to inspect package on 11/10 and held box for inspection overnight. On 11/11, package was inspected and discovered to be an undeclared hazmat. Package was then placed in a red hazmat bin with hazmat liner. DescribePack: Outer package appears undamaged, with no punctures or tears on box, but with a small amount of paint leaking from edge of top closure. Leak almost fully contained inside package. Package contains 2 paint cans; 1 can has been dented, pushing lid up and allowing leak. Other can appears undamaged. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Leak contained almost fully inside box and did not affect other packages. Box was first placed in a plain black bin with plain plastic liner and brought to QA for inspection; when package was discovered to be an undeclared hazmat, it was moved into a red hazmat bin with hazmat bag liner.

  • City: DALLAS

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: While in transit, a 330-gallon tote was punctured by an unknown source likely due to inadequate preparation for transportation. Approximately 12-gallons of (UN1268) Rikeizai SBS-A26 released onto the wooden trailer floor and the asphalt beneath the trailer. A Contractor responded to perform a tote transfer as well as cleanup the release. No storm drains, waterways, or soil were impacted.

item.title: Report E-2023110580
item.description:
Report E-2023110580

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 16, 2023, five (5) 3-gallon pails of UN3267 were crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed neutralizing granular absorbents to the spill and swept them in with hand tools. Crews used absorbent pads and a degreasing solution to wipe down the impacted freight and trailer floor, and then they restacked and repackaged the remediated freight for further shipment and processing. All neutralized product, absorbent pads, and miscellaneous cleanup debris were placed into two (2) 55-gallon drums.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 15, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of acetone was dented by an operator and released approximately fifteen (15) ounces of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. SET personnel deployed granular absorbents to the acetone impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Description: On November 15, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1219 was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews worked in previously deployed granular absorbents with hand tools.   • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: LITTLE ROCK

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LLR experienced a NA1760 Aluma-Brite HD release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of material released to a 5â x 5â and 10â x 3â areas of the trailer floor and a 10â x 3â area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas and then collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110504
item.description:
Report E-2023110504

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-23
  • City: BELLE
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, a 330-gallon tote containing (UN3265) DEPOSITROL BL5600 was punctured by a pallet likely due to inadequate preparation for transportation. Approximately 100-gallons of product released onto the dock, the trailer floor, and the asphalt beneath the trailer. A contractor cleaned-up the release and performed a tote transfer. No storm drains, waster ways, or soil were impacted by the spill.

item.title: Report E-2023110495
item.description:
Report E-2023110495

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-20
  • City: UPPER SANDUSKY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XFM experienced a UN3066 Sika Floor 161-264 Part B release from a 1-gallon metal can. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of material released to a 15â x 8â area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged pail was containerized into a double lined 55-gallon metal drum. Soda ash and absorbents were then deployed to neutralize and clean the impacted area. All impacted absorbents and impacted pallet pieces were then containerized into a second double lined 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

HCE personnel utilized oil dry and absorbent pads to remediate the site. All spent oil dry and absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. Environmental Restoration personnel deployed Soda Ash to the impacted area and recovered the neutralized material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged 1-gallon plastic jug along with three (3) impacted 1-gallon plastic jugs were placed into one (1) additional 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was on QA rollers at beginning of AM sort with an inspection required scan (usual process and placement of pkg for us). Sr QA Admin inspected pkg, cutting it open and pulling out all 4 cans; no evidence of leakage but all 4 cans were dented. Pkg put back into sort. Wet bottom on pkg found on 200 belt and was sent to QA. When starting to complete HESS, QA found the UN # on OP-900 did not match the UN # on the cans. Paperwork shows UN1133 (adhesive); can labels show UN1123 (a thinner) which is consistent with the odor of the leakage. DescribePack: 2 of the 4 cans were heavily dented along the bottom seams. Both had pinhole leaks on the bottom. No punctures visible on bottom of shipping box. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Pkg place in plastic tote. QA person opened box and turned the 2 leaking cans upside down to stop the seepage.

Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of material released to a 2â x 5â area of the trailer floor and a 2â x 3â area of the asphalt lot below due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged pail was then containerized along with all impacted absorbents into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110337
item.description:

  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 25-gallon release of Methyl Chloroform-343 (UN2831) from a 55-gallon metal drum. The product is regulated as a UN2831, 1,1,1 Trichloroethena, 6.1, III. Because of the toxic hazardous properties of the material, ERTS advised they would be sending a contractor to assist with this spill. One of the drums of the product was punctured by a forklift during unloading by the LSL terminal, causing the release to impact the trailer interior, pallet, and dock. The drum was tipped onto its side to prevent further spilling and absorbents were deployed onto the spilled area. The terminal uprighted the drum and deployed absorbents. Upon contractor arrival it was estimated 1Gal was released in a 4'x4' area. 1-85 gallon DM / contains overpacked drum, impacted absorbentsand 1-55 gallon DM / contains impacted absorbents, PPE were left onsite for the terminal to manage.

  • Description: On November 15, 2023 at 2041 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately (5) gallons of Inferno (UN1824, Sodium Hydroxide, 8, II) from (1) plastic- IBC tote that cracked due to a load shift releasing product onto the trailer floor. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Contractors neutralized and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The remaining product in the damaged tote was then transferred into a new plastic IBC tote without complication. All waste generated from addressing the release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110324
item.description:
Report E-2023110324

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: ST JAMES
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OCCIDENTAL CHEMICAL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 09:00 AM a Basic Chemicals truck driver was delivering Caustic Soda to a customer site (Mosaic) located in St. James, LA. The driver met with the customer site operator, completed the âIn the Interest of Safety Formâ (which is a form utilized by Basic Chemical truck drivers to ensure that enough space exists in a customer tank prior to unloading), hooked up offloading hoses, and began offloading. Near the end of offloading, the driver knew the tanker trailer was getting close to being empty, so he got with the customer site operator to check the level of the storage tank again to ensure there was enough room remaining in the product storage tank. The operator checked the level of the storage tank and confirmed with the driver that there was enough space to complete the offload. Not long after the customer site operator left the area the storage tank began to overflow and the Basic Chemicals truck driver immediately shut down the flow of product. The driver got with the customer site operator to notify him of the overflow and the operator stated that the tank level indicator had been malfunctioning lately. Customer site personnel were able to clean up the spill which was estimated to be approximately 20 gallons. No injuries or damage to equipment was reported.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: PRAIRIE GROVE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OCCIDENTAL CHEMICAL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 09:00 on Friday, November 3, 2023, a Basic Chemicals truck driver was delivering Hydrochloric Acid to a customer site (AZZ Inc.) located in Prairie Grove, AR. When the driver began to offload product they immediately noticed the cam-lock connection at the customers connection was dripping, so they shut down the process, cleared the line and shimmed the cam-lock ears. The driver resumed unloading a second time and noticed the fitting continued to drip so they closed the internal valve on top of the tanker trailer and replaced the gasket at the cam-lock connection. When the driver reopened the internal valve, product was released from the CPVC piping system that is connected to the internal valve of the trailer. Approximately 2 cups of product was release and spilled. No injuries or damage to equipment was reported.

  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 07, 2023, at 1135 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately (1) cup of UN1866 Resin Solution, Flammable, 3, III from (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was contained to a small area on the side of the drum only. Contractors inspected the trailer and confirmed there was no evidence of a release onto the trailer floor but found 2 additional damaged drums that were not leaking. The impacted drum was wiped clean, and the 3 damaged drums were transferred into a metal overpack without complication. The overpacks and the rest of the cargo were secured for transport and forwarded on to the original consignee. Contractors did not collect any waste during this ER response.

item.title: Report E-2023110510
item.description:
Report E-2023110510

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: TROY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 14, 2023, one (1) 275-gallon tote of paint was crushed in transit and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the loading dock floor and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Moran Environmental Recovery (MER) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized hand tools to scrape the released product off the loading dock floor. MER personnel utilized absorbent pads with a degreasing agent to collect any residual product from the impacted areas. Crews then utilized a rotary transfer pump to transfer the contents of the damaged 275-gallon tote to a new 275-gallon tote to be shipped off to its destination. MER personnel deployed granular absorbents inside the damaged tote, to solidify any remaining product, once the rotary transfer pump stopped. Crews then placed absorbent pads, under the damaged tote, and wrapped the tote in two (2) layers of poly sheeting to ensure any additional residual product was contained. All UN1263 impacted material was collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

item.description:
Report E-2023110227

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-09
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSL experienced a UN2920 Spectrus NX1103 release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of material released to an 8â x 8â area of the trailer floor and concrete lot below due to a forklift puncture. A soap and water solution was utilized to clean all impacted surfaces. Absorbents were then deployed to collect all material. The damaged jug and impacted absorbents were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged cut up pallet was placed into a separate 55-gallon poly drum. The impacted surfaces were scrubbed and treated thoroughly but still showed signs of staining, and all surfaces passed the water test. All other unaffected jugs were re-stacked to continue to the destination. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On November 13, 2023, two (2) 275-gallon totes of UN3109 were defective and released approximately seventy-five (75) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE began to unload and remediate the impacted cargo. Crews transferred approximately 200 gallons of organic peroxide from the damaged tote into a new tote. Crews cut up the empty tote and added it to a 55-gallon drum for disposal. FCE replaced the cap on the tote missing its cap. All impacted pallets, cardboard, and debris were collected for disposal

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCO experienced a release from (6) 65-pound UN2794, Batteries, Wet, Filled with Acid. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 6-gallons of battery acid released to a 4â x 7â area of the trailer floor due improper loading. Each damaged battery was placed into its own 55-gallon poly drum. A sodium bicarb solution was then utilized to clean the impacted trailer floor. All impacted absorbents, impacted pallet pieces, and PPE were placed into a seventh 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: IT was reported a one-cup spill of UN3288 "ZINC CHROMATE CZ20" that arrived damaged at Terminal NCH. The caller stated that (1) a 55-pound paper bag was damaged due to freight impact as a result of a load shift impacting Trailer #321-6239. The contractor arrived and noted the material was spilled inside of the trailer and left a trail leading out onto the dock where the pallet containing the damaged bag was. The contractor was able to confirm the dock plate prevented any material from releasing onto the ground beneath the trailer. The pallet was restacked; the damaged bag and released material were placed into (1) 55-poly drum. The waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

Absorbent was immediately placed on the spilled material and recovered.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XWK experienced a UN1791 Dynachlor release from (4) 55-gallon poly drums. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-ounces of product released to a 1â x 1â area of the pallet and drums due to the vent caps releasing as a possible cause of temperature changes/drum expansion. The four drums in shipment and the impacted pallet were wiped down and neutralized with a vinegar solution. All caps were replaced, and the drums were secured for shipment on. All impacted rags, and the damaged caps were placed into a 10-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2023110017
item.description:
Report I-2023110017

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-15
  • City: Lake Zurich
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: We conducted a test purchase of Ten Aces Medical Adhesive; a flammable aerosol product. As we suspected, the bottle was improperly packaged and it was not marked as a hazardous shipment. The bottle was shipped via USPS Ground Advantage(9400 1082 0549 9385 6823 17) Shipper did not use a strong outer box; it was shipped in a bubble mailer. Shipper did not use Limited Quantity labels. Shiper did not use Orientation labels. Shipper did not use a plastic bag and absorbant material(USPS requirement). Shipper did not declare the parcel contains a hazardous item(USPS requirement) Note that Ten Aces Medical also ships larger quantities, and international air shipments. We are concerned because Ten Aces Medical appears to operate with a general disregard for DOT regulations, FDA

UPON INSPECTION OF PACKAGE CONTENTS THERE IS ONE BOTTLE OF 3-METHYLINDOLE (SKATOLE), >99% ACS GRADE, CAS: 83-34-1. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 3V5R01, YANNI MORAITES, 2838 NW 41ST AVE., GAINESVILLE FL 32605. UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWO REGULATED DANGEROUS GOODS CHEMICALS. ONE BOTTLE IS IODOMETHANE, CAS: 74-88-4 REGULATED AS UN2644, METHYL IODIDE, 6.1, PG I. ONE BOTTLE IS BROMOETHANE, CAS: 74-96-4 REGULATED AS UN1891, ETHYL BROMIDE, 3 (6.1),II. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 3V5R01, YANNI MORAITES, 2838 NW 41ST AVE., GAINESVILLE FL 32605.

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: DFW AIRPORT
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: This passenger seated on 32H came to the back galley during the second break and told us one of his 3-4 batteries of his vape pen was hot and the wrapper around the battery is half way burnt. They were four flight attendants(#6.#8.#9) in the back galley including myself(#3) and we all smelled the burning odor. We took the battery from the passenger and pulled up standard procedures from manual, retrieved the fire containment bag from compartment 768, flowed the steps and sealed the bag and put it in a empty cart in compartment 972. Upon landing the bag was handed to the passenger and he gave it to people who met the flight. Captain was notified right away and everyone has been monitoring the situation. Management was meeting the flight.

  • Description: Driver was on store lot unloading compartment number 4 of our DOT tank trailer. Driver did not latch the fittings to the drop tube correctly. When the material started to flow it 'jumped' like normal and the hose disconnected from the drop tube resulting in a spill of diesel fuel of around 170 gallons. The driver stopped the flow of product and contacted the local fire department. York local fire department personnel, in house clean up, and 3rd party clean up teams all responded to the scene. We also filed a report with the Pennsylvania Dept. of Environmental Protection.

  • Description: On October 02, 2023, at 1147 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Hub Group personnel in Bloomington, California regarding the release of approximately (30) gallons of F-204, Liquid Alkaline Foam Cleaner and Degreaser UN3266 Corrosion Liquid, Basic, Inorganic, N.O.S., (Sodium Silicate), 8, III Cleaning Compound, 55 from (6) 5-gallon poly pails. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to a 16' x 7' area on the trailer floor. Contractors were able to clean the release without complication. All waste generated was containerized in (2) 55-gallon poly drum which was staged onsite by contractors in preparation for proper disposal.

  • Description: The spill consisted of (2) 275 gallon metal totes containing Unisol Liquid Red BK-50 (UN1993), which released from the top of both totes due to improper packaging on the totes. The terminal stated the lids on both totes were not sufficiently sealed properly, causing approximately 10 ounces combined to slosh out from both totes during transit. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who stated they wiped up the spilled amount with Oil Dri and placed the contents into a 5 gallon poly drum. The terminal tightened the lids on both totes and moved them on to the consignee. The 5Gal poly drum of waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

  • Description: On 10/19/23 a trailer at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Henderson, CO was observed to be leaking. Upon investigation it was discovered that three 28-gallon plastic bins containing IV bags fell over while in transportation due to the shipment not being properly secured. After the containers fell, some of the IV Bags fell and ruptured due to weight and impact. Approximately 15 gallons released onto the trailer floor and ground beneath the trailer. Facility personnel conducted cleanup operations.

item.title: Report E-2023110269
item.description:
Report E-2023110269

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-16
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Veolia employee at Veolia's ten-day intransit facility in Fremont, CA was moving two 55 gal drums to load onto a trailer with a forklift. The forklift had a double drum attachment which was used to pick up and move the drums. The employee raised the forklift but he failed to lift the drums high enough which resulted in one of the drum being smashed between the drum attachment stabilizing bar and the trailer floor frame. This resulted in one of the drums being crushed and causing a leak. Another employee got on the forklift and quickly brought the drums down to the ground and disengaged the drum grabber so that the drum could be tilted to the side to minimize the spill. Other Veolia employees quickly grabbed absorbent and contained the spill. The damaged drum was placed into an 85 gal poly salvage drum and absorbent was used to cleaned the area. Pressure washer was used to decontaminated the affected area. The spilled occurred on asphalt and did not result in release to the environment.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/31/2023, at 0959 hours, personnel in the CSXT Radnor Yard discovered GATX5945, a loaded tank car of Sulfuric Acid, leaking from top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Veolia, was notified directly. Marion Environmental Inc. (MEI), a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found a pressure relief vent with a blown rupture disc. After inspection it was found that the PRV did not have the required surge protection. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâs representative- Jeff Humphries. Contractor personnel removed the blown rupture disk and installed anew 2â SS 165 psi rupture disk, decontaminated the car, and remediated the environmental impact. The car was held at Radnor Yard pending additional repairs by a certified Mobile Repair Unit.

item.title: Report E-2023110225
item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: MCCAMMON
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit the driver stopped for a break and performed a load check and noticed a dark orangish liquid dripping for his trailer around 0930. The driver then put down some absorbent pads and a bucket to help mitigate the release. He then called in to report the release. We then dispatched a team to go out to the seen and start the clean up process. The team arrived on seen at approximately 1500 and dawned the proper PPE and began the clean up procedure. The drum had a small pinhole above the top chime that looks like it may have been rubbing against another container or pallet during transit. The drum was overpacked and all absorbent material was disposed of and transported for disposal per proper regulation.

  • Description: It was reported that due to a forklift incident, approximately 2 ounces of Klean Strip Paint Thinner (hazardous - UN1263) was released. The released product was contained to the dock floor and had dried. The terminal felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product and 2 damaged cans were placed into a 5 gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. Waste was left for the terminal to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately half a gallon or less of Unisol Liquid Red SPX (UN1268), which released from (1) 350-gallon metal tote. It was reported the gasket on top of the tote was not sealed properly, causing the liquid to slosh about during transit and spill out along the top and the sides of the tote. Only the top of the tote was impacted, no impact to the floor or surrounding areas. The contractor was able to replace the seal on the tote, securing it. The remaining product was able to continue transport.

  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 27, 2023, eight (8) one-gallon jugs of UN3264 were crushed in transit and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES+ to remediate the impacted site. ES+ personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN3264-impacted impacted trailer and concrete pavement. The crew de palletized, re palletized, and shrink wrapped the freight for the customer. ES+ personnel solidified the damaged jugs of product. The damaged jugs and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CONSOLIDATED RAIL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 11, 2023 at 11:45 during a joint Mechanical inspection with FRA at the Conrail Pavonia Terminal PROX 280095 a residue tank car of acetone dripping from the bottom outlet valve of the tank car. Upon inspection it was found that the bottom outlet valve was partially open and the closure pin was not in place. The valve was closed and the pin was replaced in the retainer thus stopping the leak. Marion Environmental, an approved Conrail Contractor was notified to respond, inspect and secure the tank car. Marion personnel, removed the bottom outlet cap and drained the product below the valve. They also found both the liquid and vapor valve secondary plugs less than tool tight. Once the tank car was secured it was released to transportation. FRA Hazardous Material Inspector, Joe Bowen made notifications to both the Shipper and Consignee of the incident. Cause Code: 2 x ( 4 + 3 + 0 ) x ( 2+ 0 ) = 28

  • Description: On October 23, 2023, at 1418 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner Transportation Systems personnel in Romeoville, Illinois regarding the damage of approximately (1) 55-gallon drum containing Ethyl Methacrylate (UN2277, 3, II). Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed (1) 55-gallon drum containing Ethyl Methacrylate (UN2277, 3, II) was punctured, with NO release seen. They were able to transfer the contents of the drum into a new 65-gallon poly overpack without complication. The 65-gallon poly overpack containerized waste was staged onsite in preparation for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110060
item.description:
Report E-2023110060

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: TARRANT
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN EARTH SPECIALTY WASTE SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The tanker had been picked up from a 3rd party tanker cleaning company. The investigation revealed that during the cleanout the 3rd party had removed the cleanout port cap on top of the tanker and didn't fully secure the cap once the tanker was cleaned out. The tanker was then sent to pickup a load at PPG Industries, the driver only checked the top hatch and hose valves after loading. Upon leaving the shipping facility the driver stopped at a scale 40 miles away, there was no evidence at this time of any release. Upon reaching his final destination he noticed material had sprayed out of the top of the tanker from the top of the tanker from the cleanout port. The cap was still affixed but he was able to hand tighten it. Based upon scale tickets from the beginning and end of his trip we were able to determine the amount that had released 45lbs = 5 gallons. The tanker showed signs of the material spraying onto the top portion of tanker.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCF experienced a customer location release of UN2693 Sodium Bisulfite Solution 40% from (3) 275-gallon poly totes. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 10â x 30â area of the trailer and concrete lot below. The release occurred due to high temps expanding the totes/loose caps as well as small puncture holes in the tote bodies. The material in the three totes were transferred into new totes. Soda ash was utilized to neutralize the release & absorbents were then deployed to clean all released product. All impacted absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged totes were then cut up and containerized into (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was removed from site pending disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023101231
item.description:
Report X-2023101231

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-22
  • City: MACON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Responded to report of Nitric acid leak from tank car GATX220384 in Brosnan Yard Macon GA. Upon inspection by a contractor, the leak was coming from the liquid line valve. The liquid line valve was in closed position but product was leaking past the valve and the secondary closure cam lock cap. The cam Lock cap was missing a gasket. A gasket was installed for the cap and 4psi of pressure was scrubbed off of the tank car. The leak was stopped. The car will be held pending transfer of load.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Norfolk Southern personnel reported tank car GATX73831 leaking from the top of the car. Upon inspection by a contractor, the leak was found to be from the liquid valve blind flange. The leak resulted from a defective blind flange gasket and product leaking past the closed liquid line valve. A new blind flange gasket was installed and the leak stopped. The shipper was notified and is arranging for a certified mobile shop to replace the valve.

item.title: Report E-2023110381
item.description:
Report E-2023110381

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: WEATHERFORD
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver had loaded diesel into compartments 1,3 and 4, Driver states he put out cones and stuck tanks. Driver started unloading Compartment 4 into tank 5 and Compartment 1 into tank 4. Driver states that tank 5 had 81â in tank prior to dropping and tank 4 had 80â. Compartment 4 Tank 5 drop completed, and the driver drained the hose and disconnected from truck but left the drop hooked up to ground connection. Driver was planning to move the hose and drop gun from compartment 4 tank 5 to compartment 3 tank 7. Driver checked the other hose and notice the well on tank 4 started to fill up. Driver shut down unloading from compartment 1. The manifold system between the tanks caused tank 5 to fill the well along with product to come back out of hose on the ground. Driver tried to cap the end of the hose that was still hooked up to tank 5 drop and was sprayed with diesel. Driver had to drop the rest of compartment 1 into tank 7. All the diesel tanks are Mani folded together.

  • Description: Technically this spill was related to our driver fueling the tractor trailer fuel tank and not the actual trailer vessel. However, Driver bypassed safety feature on the fuel dispenser handle by putting something under it to hold it open. Came into the terminal while fueling and when he returned fuel had spilled from his tank into the gravel and traveled downhill to the tree line. CDG managed the spill cleanup. Estimated gallons of diesel fuel was 30 gallons. Again, this is from fueling the tractor and not related to the trailer vessel.
